title: scale
description: Scale data to unit variance and zero mean.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. List of modalities to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. List of modalities to process.

input_layer.description: Type: `string`. Input layer with data to scale
input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer with data to scale. Uses .X by default

output_layer.description: Type: `string`. Output layer where scaled data will be stored
output_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Output layer where scaled data will be stored. If not specified, .X will be used.

max_value.description: Type: `double`. Clip (truncate) to this value after scaling
max_value.help_text: Type: `double`. Clip (truncate) to this value after scaling. Does not clip by default.

zero_center.description: Type: `boolean_false`, default: `true`. If set, omit zero-centering variables, which allows to handle sparse input efficiently
zero_center.help_text: Type: `boolean_false`, default: `true`. If set, omit zero-centering variables, which allows to handle sparse input efficiently.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects
output_compression.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects.
By default no compression is applied.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
